result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: from Racine County Alternatives Program - Incident Report

1:34 PM Defendant Michael D Hicks in court.  Attorney Annette E Rauch in court for Michael D Hicks.  Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Defense is requesting a change of plea date.
BTC: Matter adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
State's Notice of Intent to introduce certified public records w/o extrinsic evidence
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any firearms. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:14 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael D Hicks in court.  Attorney Annette E Rauch in court for Michael D Hicks. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
